program_purpose: Rural Housing Site Loans offer two types of loans to help income-eligible applicants buy and develop housing sites.
section_523_loan_use: Section 523 loans are used to acquire and develop sites only for housing to be built using the Self-Help method.
section_524_loan_use: Low- and moderate-income families can use Section 524 Rural Housing Site Loans to acquire and develop rural housing sites with no restrictions regarding the method of construction.
who_can_apply_section_523_criteria: Section 523 loans are available to private or public nonprofit organizations that will provide sites solely for Mutual Self-Help housing.
who_can_apply_section_524_criteria: Section 524 loans are for private or public nonprofit organizations. Building sites can be sold to eligible low- and moderate-income families.
who_can_apply_nonprofits_revolving_loan_: Nonprofits with the legal authority to operate a revolving loan fund.
who_can_apply_nonprofits_capacity: Nonprofits with the financial, technical, and managerial capacity to comply with relevant federal and state laws.
section_524_loan_rate_description: Below market rate (established monthly); fixed at closing.
who_can_answer_questions_contact: A rural housing site loan specialist in your local USDA RD office can help.
what_governs_program_standards_descripti: Site development standards and policies are in USDA RD Instruction 1924-A and 1924-C.
what_governs_program_basic_instruction_d: Information can be found in RD Instruction 444.8 and RD Instruction 1924-C.
what_governs_program_pre_application_not: Before you begin your application, please contact a rural housing site loan specialist from your local USDA RD office to confirm you are using the most current information.
eligible_area_criteria: Properties must be located in eligible rural areas.
general_note_consultation_advice: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local USDA Rural Development office for help.
general_note_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
